title: WEIRD
text:
This repository contains the data and analysis scripts related to manuscript titled “Participant and Musical Diversity in Music Psychology Research” by Kelly Jakubowski, Nashra Ahmad, James Armitage, Logan Barrett, Aliya Edwards, Elizabeth Galbo, Juan S. Gómez-Cañón, Thomas A. Graves, Akvilė Jadzgevičiūtė, Connor Kirts, Imre Lahdelma, Thomas Lennie, Aliyah Ramatally, Joshua Schlichting, Chara Steliou, Keerthana Vishwanath, & Tuomas Eerola Durham University and Music and Science Lab.
The public-facing version of this repository is at https://tuomaseerola.github.io/WEIRD/.

title: WEIRD
text:
Contents

1 Data description
2 Summary results
3 Maps
4 Trends
5 Keywords

title: WEIRD
text:
Table and manuscript stats
source(‘scripts/table1.R’) # creates numbers for Table 1 source(‘scripts/report_numbers_for_MS.R’) # create numbers for the ms

MAPS —————————-
source(‘scripts/preprocess_for_maps.R’) # prepare country information
source(‘scripts/WEIRD_map.R’) # Extra plot source(‘scripts/visualise_on_map.R’) # Figure 1 (4 sub-plots)


TRENDS —————————-
source(‘scripts/trends.R’) # Visualise various trends (Figure 2)


KEYWORD ————————-
source(‘scripts/keyword_analysis.R’) # creates figure (OK)
source(‘scripts/keyword_analysis_multiple.R’) # explores multiple divisions for keywords (in progress)
#source(‘scripts/co-occurrence_visualisation.R’) # not needed

title: Data pre-processing
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.0     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(stringr)
library(ggplot2)

Take the manually annotated data.
rm(list=ls())
d <- read.csv('data/WEIRD part cleaned Feb24.csv',header = TRUE)
knitr::kable(d[1:5,1:5])










PaperTitle
Year
Journal
FirstAuthorName_cleaned
FirstAuthorCountry




Corroborating external observation by cognitve data in the description and modelling of traditional music
2010
Musicae Scientiae
Arom, Simha
France


Looking into the eyes of a conductor performing Lerdahl’s “Time after Time”
2010
Musicae Scientiae
Bigand, Emmanuel
France


Auditive Analysis of the Quartetto per Archi in due tempi (1955) by Bruno Maderna
2010
Musicae Scientiae
Adesi, Anna Rita
Italy


The Difficulty of discerning between composed and improvised nusic
2010
Musicae Scientiae
Lehmann, Andreas C.
Germany


Musical Parameters and Children’s Images of motion
2010
Musicae Scientiae
Eitan, Zohar
Israel






Add and alter variables in the data.

source('scripts/preprocess.R') # Preprocess data (includes WEIRD country index)

Preprocessing.....
Number of coded studies: 1622
Unique first authors: 1021
1. Studies with samples (human studies)
2. Studies with music (music studies)
3. Create paper_ids 
...Unique studies: 1360
4. Add study ids
5. Expand into samples....Loop across papers with multiple studies to get multiple samples (;)
6. Clean variables 
7. Combine expanded and original data 
8. Convert online studies based on SamplePrimaryCountryofOrigin
6. Handle online origin
9. Create UIDs
10. Gender balance indicators
11. WERID indicator for countries
Using WEIRD_country_index: Krys
11. Calculate weighted mean and sd age 
12. Check counts of the expanded data frame
...Original: 1622 obs
...Expanded: 1743 obs
...Within expanded:1622
...Number of papers (study1 and sample0): 1360
Final dataframes:
 D = human studies:
1532
 DF = human studies with samples:
1653
 Unique samples in DF: 1589
 DF = human studies with distinct samples:
1589
15. Clean up





d is the original data with 1622 observations. Each row refers to a study (not article).
D is a version of the original data containing empirical/human studies with 1532 observations. Each row refers to a study (not article).
df contains samples within studies with 1743 observations.
DF contains samples with redundant samples removed. It has 1589 observations.

Within the data, there are 1360 articles.
We have created a identifier for articles (paper_id), studies (study_id), and samples (sample_id) and a unique identifier which combines these (paper_id_study_id)




CountryDataCollected_WEOG is based on WEIRD country index derived from Krys et al., (2014).
FirstAuthorCountry_WEOG is based on WEIRD country index derived from Krys et al., (2014).
gender_balance is the proportion of females in the samples


names(d)

 [1] "PaperTitle"                                  
 [2] "Year"                                        
 [3] "Journal"                                     
 [4] "FirstAuthorName_cleaned"                     
 [5] "FirstAuthorCountry"                          
 [6] "CountryDataCollected"                        
 [7] "SamplePrimaryCountryofOrigin"                
 [8] "Ethnicity"                                   
 [9] "SampleSize"                                  
[10] "SampleAgeMean"                               
[11] "SampleAgeSD"                                 
[12] "FemaleParticipantsNumber"                    
[13] "MaleParticipantsNumber"                      
[14] "SampleMusicianshipDescription"               
[15] "SamplingMethodDescription"                   
[16] "SampleOtherDescription"                      
[17] "MeanYearsEducation"                          
[18] "MusicPrimaryGenre"                           
[19] "MusicOriginCountry"                          
[20] "MusicSource"                                 
[21] "Comments"                                    
[22] "CoderName"                                   
[23] "Keywords"                                    
[24] "humansample"                                 
[25] "musicstudies"                                
[26] "paper_id"                                    
[27] "study_id"                                    
[28] "paper_id_study_id"                           
[29] "sample_id"                                   
[30] "sample_size"                                 
[31] "sample_agemean"                              
[32] "sample_agesd"                                
[33] "sample_female"                               
[34] "sample_male"                                 
[35] "sample_country_data_collected"               
[36] "sample_sampling_method_description"          
[37] "SamplePrimaryCountryofOrigin_online_inferred"
[38] "gender_balance"                              
[39] "SampleSizeAggregated"                        
[40] "CountryDataCollected_WEOG"                   
[41] "FirstAuthorCountry_WEOG"                     






needs_saving <- FALSE
if(needs_saving==TRUE){
  save(d,df,D,DF,file='data/WEIRD_data.Rdata')
}

 Solely Non-musicians:
